div.head: Capitulum 7
On circumcision
div.p: Nevertheless there was one among those sacraments, namely circumcision, conferring the same remedy against sin, that is now conferred through baptism.

Whence
Augustine :
From which circumcision was instituted among the people of God, which was at that time
the seal of the justice of faith Romanos 4:11 , was valid for the purging of a great and small, original and old, sin; just as baptism from the time in which it was instituted began to be valid for the renewal of man.
Augustinus, De nuptiis et concupiscentia, II, c. 11, n. 24 (PL 44, 450) .

Again Bede:
It is the same help of salvific healing that circumcision in the law worked against the wound of original sin, that baptism is accustomed to effect in the time of revealed grace, with the exception that they are not yet able to enter the door of the heavenly kingdom. Nevertheless, after death consoled in the bosom of Abraham, they were awaiting with happy hope entrance into eternal peace.
Beda, Homil. 10, in circumcisione Domini (PL 94:54) .

In these ways it is openly explained that, the remission of original and actual sin, small and large, was made good by God, through circumcision, for which it was instituted, just as it is now given by through baptism.
